alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Moffat County through 445 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles northeast of Rangely, or 52 miles west of Craig, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Moffat County, including the following locations... Elk Springs. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 22 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
